questions.question: Which UNESCO site in the Middle East is renowned for its rock-cut architecture and was once the capital of the Nabataean Kingdom?
questions.context: An iconic archaeological site, Petra was rediscovered by the Western world in the early 19th century and is famed for the Treasury building carved into sheer rock face.

questions.question: Where in Asia can you find a UNESCO World Heritage Site that once served as the citadel of a powerful empire during the 10th century?
questions.context: Built by the Khmer Empire, Angkor Wat is known as the largest religious monument and has appeared in numerous Hollywood films.

questions.question: This South American UNESCO World Heritage Site is known for its terraced farming system built by the Inca civilization in the 15th century. What is it?
questions.context: Standing 2,430 meters above sea level in the Andes, Machu Picchu is one of the New Seven Wonders of the World.

questions.question: Which modern architectural marvel in the United Arab Emirates was completed in 2010 and holds the title of the tallest building in the world?
questions.context: With a height of 828 meters, the Burj Khalifa features an observation deck on the 124th floor and is a symbol of architectural innovation.

questions.question: Can you identify the famous modern museum in New York City that houses a vast collection of modern and contemporary art, originally founded by Abby Aldrich Rockefeller in 1929?

answer.label: Museum of Modern Art (MoMA), New York City

questions.context: The MoMA is celebrated for its diverse collection, encompassing works from artists like Van Gogh, Warhol, and Pollock.
